comments: There are 2 tests related to resource bundles that are failing during the automated tests on the linux build box.   These tests are beng stubbed out for the time being but will be fixed for 2.0.1 RC2.

which two are they? (the failing builds will be deleted after declaring). 

I'm just curious.

The failing tests are TraitValueHelperTests.testGetNLSValue() and ModelProviderAdapterTests.testResourceBundlerProvider().   We are currently in the process of setting up a Linux test environment to debug the problem.

The failure is occuring during a call in our ResourceBundleHelper to create a URL from a directory string that should look like:  "bundleentry://25/metadata".   A MalformedURLException is being thrown.

java.net.MalformedURLException: null
	at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:635)
	at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:498)
	at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:447)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.common.metadata.internal.ResourceBundleHelper.getResourceBundle(ResourceBundleHelper.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.jst.jsf.common.metadata.internal.ResourceBundleHelper.getResourceBundle(ResourceBundleHelper.java:39)

Created an attachment (id=78031)
Fixes issues with resource bundles bound to metadata on Linux

Patch resolves issues with finding a resource bundle on Linux.

Please remove commented out code.

Approved for PMC review.
PMC approvals recieved.  Checked in to 2.0.1 and 3.0 code streams.
*** Bug 203308 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
